metadata.title: CVE-2024-56600 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:net: inet6: do not leave a dangling sk pointer in inet6_create()sock_init_data() attaches the allocated sk pointer to the provided sockobject. If inet6_create() fails later, the sk object is released, but thesock object retains the dangling sk pointer, which may cause use-after-freelater.Clear the sock sk pointer on error.

criterions.comment: linux package in oracular is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.11.0-20.20').
linux-aws package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lowlatency package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in oracular is affected and needs fixing.
